p: The caspase family proteases play an essential role in the apoptosis mechanism by controlling the pathway of apoptosis [ 54]. We found strong evidence that these caspase enzymes are activated in cells when treated with F. alnus and P. harmala leaf extracts. Caspases-8 and 9 are considered as large prodomains and initiator caspases, while caspase 6 is small prodomain [ 55]. In caspase-3 deficient cancer cells such as MCF-7, caspase 6, 8 and 9 could be involved in apoptosis [ 56]. Caspase 2 is not classified yet as an initiator or as an effector. However, it is involved in the cell death by activation within the p-53 protein with death domain PIDDosome [ 54]. From our knowledge, the effects of F. alnus and P. harmala leaf extracts on caspases activities have not been studied before.
